form.title: Build a register.conf file
form.overview: This form allows you to input the basic information needed to build a register.conf configuration file for your module. Fill in the information required and click the Generate button.

item.name: modulecode
item.label: Module name
item.description: Provide the input of the module name for the module for which a register is being generated.

item.name: modulename
item.label: Module name
item.description: Provide the name of the module that you are generating as you wish it to appear on menus and in the module catalogue.

item.name: moduledescription
item.label: Module description
item.description: Provide description of the module that you are generating as you wish it to appear in the module catalogue. Please do not use place holder text, rather provide a full description that users can understand.

item.name: helpmoduleabout
item.label: The about help text for this module
item.description: Provide text for use in the Help | About for this module.

item.name: helpmoduleabouttitle
item.label: The title for the help for this module
item.description: Provide text for use as the title for in the Help | About for this module.

item.name: copyright
item.label: Copyright holder
item.description: Provide the name of the copyright holder of the name that you are generating.

item.name: menucategory
item.label: Toolbar menu category
item.description: On what menu category do you want your module to appear on the toolbar? Leave it blank if the module should not appear on the toolbar.

item.name: sidemenucategory
item.label: Side menu category
item.description: On what side menu category do you want your module to appear on the toolbar? Leave it blank if the module should not appear on any side menu.

item.name: contextaware

option.txt: No, it is not context aware

item.label: Context aware
item.description: Is the module that you are creating aware of context?

item.name: dependscontext

option.txt: No, it does not depend on context

item.label: Depends on context
item.description: Does the module that you are creating depend on the context module?
